body:
That came in with the new package updates. We really need to get our xUnit tests running automatically, as I rushed #662 through to unblock another developer.

The root cause is that .NET enabled a safety check that is completely valid, and we were previously skirting it in these tests. The test setup function that initializes the `AssemblyLoadContext` should only be called once, but is being for each test it seems.
Sorry, I haven't even had time to get this filed to get fixed properly. Thanks for reporting.

## @andschwa I use below code to fix calling once issue, but I meet another issue when fix it.

``` sh
public static object setupObject;

        // Initialize the Core PowerShell AssemblyLoadContext
        public RunspaceTests()
        {
            if(setupObject==null)
            {
                setupObject=new object();
                PowerShellAssemblyLoadContextInitializer.SetPowerShellAssemblyLoadContext(AppContext.BaseDirectory);
            }
        }
```

---

New error:
xUnit.net DNX Runner (64-bit ubuntu.14.04-x64)
  Discovering: powershell-tests
  Discovered:  powershell-tests
  Starting:    powershell-tests
    PSTests.RunspaceTests.TestRunspaceWithPowerShellAndHost [FAIL]
      System.InvalidOperationException : Binding model is already locked for the AppDomain and cannot be reset.      Stack Trace:
           at System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext.InitializeDefaultContext(AssemblyLoadContext context)
           at System.Management.Automation.PowerShellAssemblyLoadContextInitializer.SetPowerShellAssemblyLoadContext(String basePaths)
           at PSTests.RunspaceTests..ctor()
    PSTests.RunspaceTests.TestRunspaceWithPipeline [FAIL]
      System.InvalidOperationException : The default AssemblyLoadContext in use is invalid. The default AssemblyLoadContext for PowerShell Core should be of type 'PowerShellAssemblyLoadContext'.
      Stack Trace:
           at System.Management.Automation.ClrFacade.GetAssemblyLoadContext()
           at System.Management.Automation.ClrFacade.Load(AssemblyName assembly)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfigForSingleShell.LoadMshSnapinAssembly(PSSnapInInfo mshsnapinInfo)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfigForSingleShell.LoadPSSnapIn(PSSnapInInfo mshsnapinInfo)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfigForSingleShell.LoadPSSnapIns(Collection`1 mshsnapinInfos, PSConsoleLoadException& warning)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfigForSingleShell.LoadConsole(PSConsoleLoadException& warning)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfigForSingleShell.CreateDefaultConfiguration()
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfiguration.Create()
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceFactory.CreateRunspace(PSHost host)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceFactory.CreateRunspace()
           at PSTests.RunspaceTests.TestRunspaceWithPipeline()
    PSTests.RunspaceTests.TestRunspaceWithPowerShell [FAIL]
      System.InvalidOperationException : The default AssemblyLoadContext in use is invalid. The default AssemblyLoadContext for PowerShell Core should be of type 'PowerShellAssemblyLoadContext'.
      Stack Trace:
           at System.Management.Automation.ClrFacade.GetAssemblyLoadContext()
           at System.Management.Automation.ClrFacade.Load(AssemblyName assembly)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfigForSingleShell.LoadMshSnapinAssembly(PSSnapInInfo mshsnapinInfo)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfigForSingleShell.LoadPSSnapIn(PSSnapInInfo mshsnapinInfo)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfigForSingleShell.LoadPSSnapIns(Collection`1 mshsnapinInfos, PSConsoleLoadException& warning)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfigForSingleShell.LoadConsole(PSConsoleLoadException& warning)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfigForSingleShell.CreateDefaultConfiguration()
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceConfiguration.Create()
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceFactory.CreateRunspace(PSHost host)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.RunspaceFactory.CreateRunspace()
           at PSTests.RunspaceTests.TestRunspaceWithPowerShell()
    PSTests.RunspaceTests.TestRunspaceWithFunction [FAIL]
      System.InvalidOperationException : The default AssemblyLoadContext in use is invalid. The default AssemblyLoadContext for PowerShell Core should be of type 'PowerShellAssemblyLoadContext'.
      Stack Trace:
           at System.Management.Automation.ClrFacade.GetAssemblyLoadContext()
           at System.Management.Automation.ClrFacade.Load(AssemblyName assembly)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.PSSnapInHelpers.LoadPSSnapInAssembly(PSSnapInInfo psSnapInInfo, Dictionary`2& cmdlets, Dictionary`2& providers)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.InitialSessionState.ImportPSSnapIn(PSSnapInInfo psSnapInInfo, PSSnapInException& warning)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.InitialSessionState.ImportCorePSSnapIn()
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.InitialSessionState.CreateDefault2()
           at Microsoft.PowerShell.Linux.Host.Listener..ctor(String initialScript, Boolean loadProfiles)
           at PSTests.RunspaceTests.TestRunspaceWithFunction()
    PSTests.RunspaceTests.TestRunspaceWithPowerShellAndInitialSessionState [FAIL]
      System.InvalidOperationException : The default AssemblyLoadContext in use is invalid. The default AssemblyLoadContext for PowerShell Core should be of type 'PowerShellAssemblyLoadContext'.
      Stack Trace:
           at System.Management.Automation.ClrFacade.GetAssemblyLoadContext()
           at System.Management.Automation.ClrFacade.Load(AssemblyName assembly)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.PSSnapInHelpers.LoadPSSnapInAssembly(PSSnapInInfo psSnapInInfo, Dictionary`2& cmdlets, Dictionary`2& providers)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.InitialSessionState.ImportPSSnapIn(PSSnapInInfo psSnapInInfo, PSSnapInException& warning)
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.InitialSessionState.ImportCorePSSnapIn()
           at System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.InitialSessionState.CreateDefault2()
           at PSTests.RunspaceTests.TestRunspaceWithPowerShellAndInitialSessionState()
  Finished:    powershell-tests
Can you re-test on the latest `master` branch? I know I saw the same errors in the last few days, but I can't reproduce it any more.
Strange. It only reproduces intermittently. 1/3 runs just now.
@andschwa We still repro this error, you can login ps64-ubun14-01 (IP: 10.231.73.77 ) user: root password:OpsMgr2007R2 to check the result under /root folder, thanks.
That's no problem, it reproed for me eventually, just not the first or second time. Which is strange. I'll look into this further.
